message.content:
cs.GT, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CC

Reasoning: The paper deals with bidding games on graphs, which are a subfield of game theory. Therefore, cs.GT (Game Theory and Economics) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves the study of graphs and paths, which falls under cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). The use of probabilistic connections and optimization techniques suggests that the paper could also be classified under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). Finally, the paper involves the analysis of bidding mechanisms, which could be considered a subfield of mechanism design, falling under cs.CC (Computational Complexity).
